data

Class DataSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.DataSet

  • public class DataSet
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a data set. Objects of this class store all instances as well as all information about the attributes that these instances have.
    Author:
    Matthew Bernstein - matthewb@cs.wisc.edu

    • Method Detail

      • setClassAttribute

        public void setClassAttribute(java.lang.String attrName)
        Assign the Attribute that labels the class of each instance in the data set.
        Parameters:
        attrName - the name of the attribute used to label the data

      • getClassAttribute

        public Attribute getClassAttribute()
        Get the attribute that represents the class label for instances in the data set.
        Returns:
        the attribute that labels the class of each instance

      • getClassCounts

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> getClassCounts()
        Returns:
        a mapping of each nominal value ID of the class attribute to the number of instances in the data set that are of that class

      • getClassAttributeId

        public java.lang.Integer getClassAttributeId()
        Get the Attribute ID of the attribute used to label the instances in the data set
        Returns:
        the ID of the class attribute

      • setAttributeSet

        public void setAttributeSet(AttributeSet attrSet)
        Parameters:
        attrSet - the set of attributes that all instances should have

      • setInstanceSet

        public void setInstanceSet(InstanceSet instSet)
        Parameters:
        instSet - the set of all instances in this dataset

      • getInstanceSet

        public InstanceSet getInstanceSet()
        Returns:
        the set of all instances in this data set

      • getAttributeSet

        public AttributeSet getAttributeSet()
        Returns:
        the set of all attributes that all instances in this data set have

      • getAttributeList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Attribute> getAttributeList()
        Returns:
        a list of all attributes that all instances in this data set have

      • getAttributeByName

        public Attribute getAttributeByName(java.lang.String attrName)
        Return an attribute based on its name
        Parameters:
        attrName - the target attribute's name
        Returns:
        the target attribute

      • getAttributeById

        public Attribute getAttributeById(java.lang.Integer attrId)
        Return an attribute based on its unique integer ID
        Parameters:
        attrId - the target attribute's unique integer ID
        Returns:
        the target attribute

      • getNumInstances

        public int getNumInstances()
        Returns:
        the number of instances in the data set

      • getNumAttributes

        public int getNumAttributes()
        Returns:
        the number of attributes that all instances in the data set have

      • printAttributes

        public void printAttributes()
        Print the attributes in a descriptive easy to read format such that each attribute is printed with its integer ID and each nominal value for nominal attributes is printed with its nominal value ID

      • printInstances

        public void printInstances()
        Print the instances in a descriptave easy to read format. This method checks that the data being read mirrors the ARFF file. Use this method to check the data being read in.

      • printClassCounts

        public void printClassCounts()
        Print class distribution to the console

      • calculateClassCounts

        public void calculateClassCounts()
        This method calculates how many instances are of each class label. It stores the results in a map that maps a nominal value ID of each nominal value of the class attribute to a count

      • printInstance

        public void printInstance(Instance instance)
        Print an instance to standard output.
        Parameters:
        instance - the instance to print
